abstract: Estimating optical ﬂow from facial videos is an essential preprocessing step for many applications. However, it is a challenging task as the facial videos contain rich expressions, large displacements, and complex occlusions. Obtaining the ground truth optical ﬂow for facial videos is very difﬁcult, which hinders the supervised learning of optical ﬂow from monocular in-the-wild facial videos. In this paper, we pro- vide an effective and accurate method for the unsupervised learning of optical ﬂow from facial videos. An occlusion- aware global-local matching model is introduced for the joint reasoning of optical ﬂow and occlusions. We propose a novel occlusion estimation paradigm to detect occlusions caused by facial expressions and pose variations. Experiments demon- strate that our method compares favorably against the state- of-the-art methods in facial optical ﬂow estimation.
tldr: Unsupervised method for accurate facial optical flow using occlusion-aware matching.
